derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent.: earlier denoting a lever apparatus of which one end is raised while the other is lowered, from French (earlier bacule), 'see-saw', from battre 'to bump' + cul 'buttocks'

means.word_mean: 1. a structure in which one end is counterbalanced by the other (as in a bascule bridge)
